author: sky.cactus
content: I just really dislike the idea of neutering EVM level features because a handful of armchair dapp developers couldn't think of a use case.

author: sky.cactus
content: The whole idea with an open and permissionless system is to create an environment where people can explore new novel ideas.

author: sky.cactus
content: This leads me to generally prefer higher layer solutions to security over EVM layer security.

author: sky.cactus
content: That being said, if I had to choose between cross-chain invokers and cross-chain messages, I would choose cross-chain invokers.

author: sky.cactus
content: Being able to deploy a particular invoker to the same address on every test network and mainnet is a *huge* boon to usability.

author: sky.cactus
content: If we bake in chain ID checking to the authcall, yes.

author: sky.cactus
content: I'm saying that if those are the choices, I would choose baking in the chain ID check over neutering the ability to deploy an invoker to the same address on every chain.

author: sky.cactus
content: In fact, I would argue that invokers **should** be deployed in a way that is cross-chain friendly.

author: sky.cactus
content: An invoker that only works on one chain is a bad invoker IMO.
